meanings.definition: スィナン：オスマン帝国の建築家。
meanings.english_definition: Mimar Sinan (c. 1488/1490 – 1588) was the chief Ottoman architect (Turkish: mimar) and civil engineer for sultans Suleiman the Magnificent, Selim II, and Murad III. He was responsible for the construction of more than 300 major structures and other more modest projects, such as schools. His apprentices would later design the Sultan Ahmed Mosque in Istanbul and Stari Most in Mostar.

examples.sentence: Sinan was one of the greatest architects in Ottoman history.
examples.translation: スィナンはオスマン帝国史上最も偉大な建築家の一人でした。
